verses.text: Behold my servant, whom I uphold; Mine elect, \add in whom\add* my soul delighteth; I have put my spirit upon him: He shall bring forth judgment to the Gentiles.
He shall not cry, nor lift up, Nor cause his voice to be heard in the street.
A bruised reed shall he not break, And the smoking flax shall he not quench: He shall bring forth judgment unto truth.
He shall not fail nor be discouraged, Till he have set judgment in the earth: And the isles shall wait for his law.

Thus saith God the \sc Lord\sc*, He that created the heavens, and stretched them out; He that spread forth the earth, and that which cometh out of it; He that giveth breath unto the people upon it, And spirit to them that walk therein:
I the \sc Lord\sc* have called thee in righteousness, And will hold thine hand, and will keep thee, And give thee for a covenant of the people, for a light of the Gentiles;
To open the blind eyes, To bring out the prisoners from the prison, \add And\add* them that sit in darkness out of the prison house.
I \add am\add* the \sc Lord\sc*: that \add is\add* my name: And my glory will I not give to another, Neither my praise to graven images.
Behold, the former \add things\add* are come to pass, And new \add things\add* do I declare: Before they spring forth I tell you of them.
Sing unto the \sc Lord\sc* a new song, \add And\add* his praise from the end of the earth, Ye that go down to the sea, and all that is therein; The isles, and the inhabitants thereof.

Let the wilderness and the cities thereof lift up \add their voice\add*, The villages \add that\add* Kedar doth inhabit: Let the inhabitants of the rock sing, Let them shout from the top of the mountains.
Let them give glory unto the \sc Lord\sc*, And declare his praise in the islands.
The \sc Lord\sc* shall go forth as a mighty \add man\add*, He shall stir up jealousy like a man of war: He shall cry, yea, roar; He shall prevail against his enemies.
I have long time holden my peace; I have been still, \add and\add* refrained myself: \add Now\add* will I cry like a travailing woman; I will destroy and devour at once.
I will make waste mountains and hills, And dry up all their herbs; And I will make the rivers islands, And I will dry up the pools.

And I will bring the blind by a way \add that\add* they knew not; I will lead them in paths \add that\add* they have not known: I will make darkness light before them, And crooked things straight. These things will I do unto them, and not forsake them.
They shall be turned back, they shall be greatly ashamed, that trust in graven images, That say to the molten images, Ye \add are\add* our gods.
Hear, ye deaf; And look, ye blind, that \add ye\add* may see.
Who \add is\add* blind, but my servant? Or deaf, as my messenger \add that\add* I sent? Who \add is\add* blind as he that is perfect, And blind as the \sc Lord’s\sc* servant?
Seeing many \add things\add*, but thou observest not; Opening the ears, but he heareth not.
The \sc Lord\sc* is well pleased for his righteousness’ sake; He will magnify the law, and make \add it\add* honourable.

But this \add is\add* a people robbed and spoiled; \add They are\add* all of them snared in holes, And they are hid in prison houses: They are for a prey, and none delivereth; \add For\add* a spoil, and none saith, Restore.
Who among you will give ear to this? \add Who\add* will hearken and hear for the time to come?
Who gave Jacob for a spoil, and Israel to the robbers? Did not the \sc Lord\sc*, he against whom we have sinned? For they would not walk in his ways, Neither were they obedient unto his law.

Therefore he hath poured upon him the fury of his anger, and the strength of battle: And it hath set him on fire round about, yet he knew not; And it burned him, yet he laid \add it\add* not to heart.
